label: 連署
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 3:  Medieval Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1990
説明文: An official subordinate to the regent (shikken) of the Kamakura bakufu whose signature was placed beside that of the shikken on official documents. After the first assignment to Hōjō Tokifusa (1175-1240) in 1224, the cosignership, like the regency itself, became a prerogative of the Hōjō family.　[執権、北条時房]
